segments.en: Numbered Discourses 10
5. Abuse
45. Entering a Royal Harem
“Mendicants, there are ten drawbacks to entering a royal harem.
What ten?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, rājā mahesiyā saddhiṃ nisinno hoti.
segments.en: Firstly, a king is sitting with his chief queen
when a monk enters.

segments.pli: Mahesī vā bhikkhuṃ disvā sitaṃ pātukaroti, bhikkhu vā mahesiṃ disvā sitaṃ pātukaroti.
segments.en: When the queen sees the monk she smiles, or when the monk sees the queen he smiles.
So the king thinks:
‘They’ve done it for sure, or they will do it.’
This is the first drawback of entering a royal harem.

segments.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, rājā bahukicco bahukaraṇīyo aññataraṃ itthiṃ gantvā na sarati:
segments.en: Furthermore, a king has many duties, and much to do. He has sex with one of the women but doesn’t remember.
She gets pregnant from that.
So the king thinks:

segments.pli: ‘na kho idha añño koci pavisati, aññatra pabbajitena.
segments.en: ‘No-one else has entered here, except for that monk.
Could this be the monk’s doing?’
This is the second drawback of entering a royal harem.

segments.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, rañño antepure aññataraṃ ratanaṃ nassati.
segments.en: Furthermore, a gem is lost somewhere in the royal harem.
So the king thinks:

segments.pli: ‘na kho idha añño koci pavisati, aññatra pabbajitena.
segments.en: ‘No-one else has entered here, except for that monk.
Could this be the monk’s doing?’
This is the third drawback of entering a royal harem.

segments.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, rañño antepure abbhantarā guyhamantā bahiddhā sambhedaṃ gacchanti.
segments.en: Furthermore, secret deliberations in the royal harem are leaked outside.
So the king thinks:

segments.pli: ‘na kho idha añño koci pavisati, aññatra pabbajitena.
segments.en: ‘No-one else has entered here, except for that monk.
Could this be the monk’s doing?’
This is the fourth drawback of entering a royal harem.

segments.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, rañño antepure pitā vā puttaṃ pattheti putto vā pitaraṃ pattheti.
segments.en: Furthermore, in a royal harem, a father longs for their son, or a son longs for his father.
They think:

segments.pli: ‘na kho idha añño koci pavisati, aññatra pabbajitena.
segments.en: ‘No-one else has entered here, except for that monk.
Could this be the monk’s doing?’
This is the fifth drawback of entering a royal harem.

segments.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, rājā nīcaṭṭhāniyaṃ ucce ṭhāne ṭhapeti.
segments.en: Furthermore, the king promotes someone to a higher position.

segments.pli: Yesaṃ taṃ amanāpaṃ tesaṃ evaṃ hoti:
segments.en: Those who are upset by this think:
‘The king is close to that monk.
Could this be the monk’s doing?’
This is the sixth drawback of entering a royal harem.

segments.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, rājā uccaṭṭhāniyaṃ nīce ṭhāne ṭhapeti.
segments.en: Furthermore, the king demotes someone to a lower position.

segments.pli: Yesaṃ taṃ amanāpaṃ tesaṃ evaṃ hoti:
segments.en: Those who are upset by this think:
‘The king is close to that monk.
Could this be the monk’s doing?’
This is the seventh drawback of entering a royal harem.

segments.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, rājā akāle senaṃ uyyojeti.
segments.en: Furthermore, the king dispatches the army at the wrong time.

segments.pli: Yesaṃ taṃ amanāpaṃ tesaṃ evaṃ hoti:
segments.en: Those who are upset by this think:
‘The king is close to that monk.
Could this be the monk’s doing?’
This is the eighth drawback of entering a royal harem.

segments.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, rājā kāle senaṃ uyyojetvā antarāmaggato nivattāpeti.
segments.en: Furthermore, the king dispatches the army at the right time, but orders it to turn back while still on the road.

segments.pli: Yesaṃ taṃ amanāpaṃ tesaṃ evaṃ hoti:
segments.en: Those who are upset by this think:
‘The king is close to that monk.
Could this be the monk’s doing?’
This is the ninth drawback of entering a royal harem.

segments.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, rañño antepuraṃ hatthisammaddaṃ assasammaddaṃ rathasammaddaṃ rajanīyāni rūpasaddagandharasaphoṭṭhabbāni, yāni na pabbajitassa sāruppāni.
segments.en: Furthermore, in the royal harem there is a trampling of elephants, horses, and chariots, as well as arousing sights, sounds, smells, tastes, and touches that do not befit a monk.
This is the tenth drawback of entering a royal harem.

segments.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, dasa ādīnavā rājantepurappavesane”ti. (10)
segments.en: These are the ten drawbacks of entering a royal harem.”
